comments.author: Big Bertha
comments.content:
Patty Hajdu.....you may have the title of Health Minister, but you know absolutely nothing about this virus.  You have not familiarized yourself with international information on the virus.  "Not many cases in Canada".....you should change that to not many KNOWN cases.....considering it has an up to 24 days contagious incubation period.
Canadians are a very robust people who never practice running to the doctor for the sniffles or cough, we head to the pharmacy to load up on over the counter helps.  By the time we are too sick, we will have infected many around us.  
Most of us have been diligent to educate ourselves with information from Infectious disease doctors internationally and international news coverage on the matter.....instead of the negligent Canadian government news babble.
Because the news in Canada has been shrouded in negligence and non transparency in reporting, the most vulnerable among us have not been given the opportunity to adequately prepare.  
Healthcare workers on the frontline in China with full hazmat gear have been contracting this virus and even dying.  With the lack of protective masks in Canada....what will the vulnerable public do?
Why must you learn from experience and not global observation?
Well maybe class action lawsuits from the surviving families regarding the death of their vulnerable loved ones could prove to be the valuable life lesson experience you need.
